alert.note: Alert for Benton; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 12:26PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton and Washington AR. In northeast Oklahoma, Adair and Delaware. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Siloam Springs... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Gentry... Elkins... Tontitown... West Fork... Decatur... Greenland... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Highfill... Watts... Springtown... Cincinnati... Drake Field Airport... Johnson... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
